title: Tallulah Bankhead: A Scandalous Life
description: Marlene Dietrich called her 'The most immoral woman who ever lived', Cecil Beaton described her as a 'wicked archangel' . Born in Alabama in 1903, she became a big star in London in the early 1920's. Branded 'an unsafe and unsavory person' by the Hays commission in the early 1930's. In this highly entertaining book David Bret tells Tallulah's story in the only way it could be with shocking honesty and wit. What emerges is a vivid portrait of an immoral and wicked woman who was every inch a star and remains one of the greatest legends this century has ever seen.
author: David Bret
